snippet: Carolyn Maloney, a New York Democrat, has asked federal regulators for details about the independent contractors who examined borrowers’ cases.
abstract: Rep Carolyn Maloney, New York Democrat and member of House Financial Services Committee, asks federal regulators who oversee foreclosure reviews at big banks to provide details about independent contractors who examined borrowers’ cases; contractors reportedly received more than $1 billion in fees, which ultimately led to $3.3 billion cash settlement for borrowers.
lead_paragraph: Carolyn Maloney, a New York Democrat, has asked federal regulators for details about the independent contractors who examined borrowers’ cases.

headline.seo: Carolyn Maloney Questions Costs of Foreclosure Reviews
headline.main: Lawmaker Seeks Details on Foreclosure Reviews
headline.print_headline: Lawmaker Seeks Details on Foreclosure Reviews
